abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column looks at double life of Clarence King, white man, nationally renowned explorer and surveyor in 1800s who used his work as traveling geologist to maintain his secret life as black man in Brooklyn and Queens; there he was James Todd, who told his wife and children he worked as Pullman porter; Rachel Dolezal, former NAACP official who is white, made current headlines for pretending to be black.
lead_paragraph: American history is dotted with cases of white men and women driven by love, ambition or other forces to defy laws and conventions meant to separate blacks and whites.

headline.main: Driven by Love or Ambition, Slipping Across the Color Line Through the Ages
headline.print_headline: Driven by Love or Ambition, Slipping Across the Color Line Through the Ages

snippet: American history is dotted with cases of white men and women driven by love, ambition or other forces to defy laws and conventions meant to separate blacks and whites.
